greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let u(1) = x and  u(n+1) = (n^2/u(n)) + 1 for n >= 1; then a(n) is such that u(n) =(a(n)*x + b(n))/(c(n)*x + d(n)) (in lowest terms) and a(n), b(n), c(n), d(n) are positive integers.
comment: For x real <> 1 - 1/log(2), Lim_{n -> infinity} abs(u(n) - n) = abs((x - 1)/(1 + (x - 1)*log(2))). [Corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, May 18 2020]
link: Petros Hadjicostas, Proofs of various results about the sequence u(n), 2020.
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Oct 14 2002
